qas.question: What did Emperor Haile Selassie seek to annex in the 1950's?
Who laid claim to Eritrea and Italian Somaliland in a letter to Franklin D. Roosevelt?
Why did the British and Americans want to cede most of Eritrea to the Ethiopians?

answers.text: as a reward for their support during World War II

qas.question: Who consistently requested that a referendum be held immediately to settle the question of Eritrean sovereignty?

answers.text: The Independence Bloc of Eritrean parties

qas.question: Who did Ethiopians support in World War II?
In what decade did Haile Selassie become emperor of Ethiopia?
What nation was part of the Independence Bloc of Eritrean parties?
Who was Franklin D. Roosevelt the leader of?
In what city was the First Session of the United Nations held?
Who was leading Italian Somaliland during this time after World War II?

context: In the <b5_0>1950s<b5_0/>, the Ethiopian feudal administration under <a1_0>Emperor <b9_0>Haile Selassie<b9_0/><a1_0/> sought to annex <a0_0>Eritrea and Italian Somaliland<a0_0/>. He laid claim to both territories in a letter to Franklin D. Roosevelt at the <b8_0>Paris<b8_0/> Peace Conference and at the First Session of the United Nations. In the United Nations, the debate over the fate of the former Italian colonies continued. <a4_0><b7_0>The British<b7_0/> and Americans<a4_0/> preferred to cede all of Eritrea except the Western province to the <b6_0>Ethiopians<b6_0/> <a2_0>as a reward for their support during World War II<a2_0/>. <a3_0>The Independence Bloc of Eritrean parties<a3_0/> consistently requested from the UN General Assembly that a referendum be held immediately to settle the Eritrean question of sovereignty.
